climtools package¶

Submodules¶

climtools.stat module¶

climtools.stat.gen_seasonal_cycle(start, end, frequency)¶

Generates an artifical seasonal cycle for times between a given start and endpoint with a given frequncy

Parameters

  • start (cftime.Datetime) – Beginning of the period

  • end (cftime.Datetime) – End of the period

  • frequency (string) –

Returns

Dataset containing seasonal cycle

Return type

xarray.Dataset

climtools.temporal.get_temporal_resolution(data)¶

Returns the temporal resolution of a given xarray object from the time_bnds variable :param data: Input Dataset must contain at least the dimension “time_bnds” :type data: Dataset

Returns

Name of the temporal resolution detected

Return type

str

climtools.temporal.is_leap_year(time)¶

Checks whether a given cf.Datetime is actually a leap year. Function based on https://github.com/Unidata/cftime/blob/master/src/cftime/_cftime.pyx

Parameters

time (cftime.Datetime) – Datetime to check

climtools.temporal.temporal_downsampling(data, target_resolution)¶

This function downsamples (averages) a given dataset to a given target resolution. The target resolutions must be coarser than the time resolution of the dataset provided.py

Parameters

  • data (xarray.Dataset) – Input Dataset. Must contain dimension time as well as the variable time_bnds for inferring the resolution

  • target_resolution (string) – Target Resolution.

Returns

[description]

Return type

[type]

climtools.utils module¶

climtools.utils.decompose_dependent_variables(data, dimension)¶

Returns all variables of a dataset that depend on a specified dimension

Parameters

  • data (xarray.Dataset) – Dataset to be analysed

  • dimension (string) – Name of the dimension

Returns

dictionary containing the names of dependent and independent variables

Return type

dict
